o edit my preferances. Catch me later guys. I need to get up and around and=

as very dissapointed in the AKG MkII K240's that I ordred. A friend that wa=
s an "audio buff" recommended them. There useless for this work though (not=
 as sensitive) I'll send the Numarks out around Monday or Tuesday. --- In E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@> wrote:
  > >

nks Jim! IMO, that is the biggest problem that serious researchers of any f=
ield face-their own biases. It is good to be skeptical, but you HAVE to kee=
p open to any possibility, and realize that there can be holes in even your=
 own, well thought out theories. Once you think you know it all and don't n=
eed to test further, you are lost.
  > > 
  > > I have several pairs of hea=
dphones, but my best pair are Sennheiser eH 150's. I don't truly know a who=
le lot about headphones, I only know these came highly recommended and were=
 moderately priced. I think I paid $50. They are very light and comfortable=
 for full headphones. They have thick, padded ear cuffs and a padded headba=
nd. The others I have-the ear bud types, make my ears hurt. On investigatio=
ns I use them for live monitoring, so I wear them for long periods of time.=

o let me :)

  > > > Yes April, I have the same belie=
f as you.....if EVP's are of the personal nature, no matter if they yell in=
to the microphone....if you are not the intended receiver you will NEVER he=
ar or understand it. I do know my EVP's are very LOW audio. I need to work =
with that and AMP them I guess. In some recordings (1927 is one of them) I =
can't hear the voice sometimes, that is how low it is. But tonight I finish=
ed my comparison recorder evaluations (ran 3 recorders that night) my Sony =
ICD B7 also heard the date. The Panasonic RR-US360 could not hear it. I wil=
l upload a GET-OUT evp that the RR-DR60 only heard too. Was recorded same t=
ime as the asking of date.As for "what kind of ears I have" :) I do have pr=
etty good hearing (but have some loss in certain areas) maybe my losses are=
 closer to the static's level and I am helped there....I don't know yet. I =
have seen enough people (half) that I personally let hear these....they can=
't hear them either (some of them) so I understand why others can't hear th=
em. Just to "loop" (continual repeat) of only the evp is helpful sometimes.=
 --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "threadsintyme@" <Threadsintyme@> wrote:

k Sumption To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 2:14 PMSu=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
  > > > > I always l=
isten to EVP wiht my ears!--I know--alien humor.
  > > > > 
  > > > > On Fr=
i, May 15, 2009 at 1:24 PM, April Abercrombie <april@> wrote:
  > > > > 
  =
> > > > 
  > > > > I always listen to EVP's with high quality headphones. I=
n the "tomorrow let you know" EVP, I do hear something....just can't be sur=
e that it is a voice. I does have a cadence similar to someone speaking, bu=
t it could just as easily be something present in the environment-a natural=
 background noise. There is no way for me to tell for certain as it is just=
 too feint. I can't make out any clear words. Sure-I could probably matrix =
some in, but that is all it would be. For an EVP to be considered proof pos=
itive of spirit communication by the community at large, it has to be clear=
 enough that many people hear the same thing, without hints or coaxing. If =
you have to have high quality devices to make it out, it just isn't good en=
ough. That does not mean it isn't a true EVP, just that it isn't good enoug=
h to stand as evidence. As for the whistle, it sounded like feedback to me =
as well, but I will have to take you word for it that you were no where nea=
r any other electronics or EMF's that could contribute to feedback. Even so=
, if I am trying to remain unbiased and objective, there is no way for me t=
o say this is a spirit, without personally being with you when you caught i=
t. The only thing I can still say about it is could be, but for me it is no=
n conclusive. If someone does not hear what you are hearing, try to remain =
objective and just understand that it isn't personal. You have to understan=
d that with just these recordings alone, there is no way to scientifically =
prove what you have recorded is spirit communication. If you could get cons=
istent, intelligent question and answer recordings, then you would be alot =
closer. Here again, we are back to the "So what?" thing. You don't HAVE to =
prove anything scientifically, unless you want others to completely believe=
 in your evidence. The theory that is being kicked around is that some EVP'=
s are personal, and only meant for the person recording them to hear. If th=
is is the case, no matter how clear something is to you, others may not hea=
r it. April ----- Original Message ----- From: James W. Hyslope To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 12:02 PMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re: =
what you hear is what you get
  > > > > Okay, I can respect that. If you ca=
n't hear them then it must be either mechanical (sound card or headphones)o=
r maybe your hearing has loss in those frequencies....Some of these are not=
 very clear or loud enough too. But many will depend on your computer sound=
 card & your headphones. I have let an older man listen (in his late 60's) =
and he has heard most all of the audio. Same with a few guys at work. Some =
hear them right away, and others can't until I loop the actually EVP for a =
few tries. I personally use a Dell Latitude D430 to hear these. I can hear =
some on my cell phone. Headphones are a must....or you won't hear anything =
either way. *But some can be heard on cell phone without headphones. The co=
nversion to MP3 has also caused some loss, but I am still able to hear them=
 when I review from this site (but I have the repetive hearing syndrome in =
this area no doubt). Although I do have some disbelief (shock) that a few o=
f these are not discernable. Go back and listen to "tomorrow let you know" =
is in a gruffy-robotic melodic tone at the very end but with higher natural=
 volume. And if you couldn't hear the whistle...I would suggest the need to=
 remove the cotton from the ear :) As for feedback.....feedback from what? =
I only had one recorder working here. I would rather hear someone say "I" m=
ade the whistle....that would be more understandable. And is very true....i=
f someone "tells" the group that THIS is supposed to be what WAS said, then=
 is very difficult to clear the mind to hear it any other way. Kinda like t=
rying to hum another song while a different one is playing :) --- In EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@> wrote:
  > > > > >
  > > > =
> > Here's the thing though - if you put something out there, and ask peopl=
e to listen to it, your inviting opinions. Some will be in agreement, and s=
ome won't, no matter what.
  > > > > > 
  > > > > > If EVP messages are for=
 the one that recorded them, then it shouldn't surprise you, or offend you,=
 if someone doesn't hear the same thing you do. If you don't want contrary =
opinions on something, then you should not give people the chance to critiq=
ue.
  > > > > > 
  > > > > > Now I could see if someone flat out said your =
recordings were all trash, period. You would have every right to be angry, =
but no one is saying that, at least I am not saying that.
  > > > > >

 Sometimes I could sort of hear something that sort of sounded like what yo=
u suggested, but I could also hear it in other ways, or not at all.
  > > >=
 > > 
  > > > > > So my suggestion to you, if you want to get less subjecti=
ve conjuctures or simply less affirmations of your own interpretations, is =
to post the future ones without labels. The labels you give can influence t=
he listeners: when you have a sound that could be several things, and you n=
ote that it sounded like "keep it moving", the listener can find it nearly =
impossible to try NOT to hear what you heard, and so not be able to give a =
fresh perspecive to help your research methods. 
  > > > > > 
  > > > > > 
=
  > > > > > 
  > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hyslope"=
 <clockdryve@> wrote:
  > > > > > >
  > > > > > > Go to my Folder in the fi=
les section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR =
ME" and let me know if I am of the serious type. In my short time I have ga=
thered enough "proof" for myself that this method works for ME. And from wh=
at I have seen from others that I have let "listen" to my files (friends) I=
 am blessed with the "ability" to HEAR very low audio artifacts....so this =
will help me in my RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (o=
r help others) with their goals. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I wa=
s lucky enough to catch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a f=
ew evp's real close together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a m=
ale use a different number than what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I wa=
s saying in recorder) and the male evp said 13....then a female laughs. All=
 this was missed by the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in both recorders) =
BUT then the DR60 "caught" the B7 "napping" at near the end of the 5 second=
 clip....the DR60 heard "let me out" in a clear (quite) males voice. So thi=
s is very promising piece of evidence for me. **those 2 recordings have bee=
n uploaded to my folder. I will include an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), =
Panasonic RR-US360 (when I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my R=
R-QR100, and one more (can't remember what brand-model of this last---due t=
o arrive) LOL. I need to build a multiple mounting devise to aid in putting=
 these into tandem service. Then I think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my =
"Control" recorder....by using it on the HQ settings. I am looking to build=
 a "subsonic" microphone also (something to do with those low "booms" that =
I have noticed lead or follow many evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. =
Falure is NOT an option. Haha.....
